Package camzup.core

Class Gradient

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Gradient
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUtils, Iterable<ColorKey>
public class Gradient extends Object implements IUtils, Iterable<ColorKey>
A mutable, extensible class that contains a list of keys which hold colors at steps in the range [0.0, 1.0] . Allows smooth color transitions to be evaluated by a factor.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final TreeSet<ColorKey>
    keys
    The set of keys.

    Description
    Gradient()
    Creates a gradient with two default color keys, clear black at 0.0 and opaque white at 1.0.

    Creates a gradient from a list of scalars; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].

    Creates a gradient from color keys.

    Constructs a copy of a source gradient.
    Gradient(Collection<Color> colors)
    Creates a gradient from a collection of color integers; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].

  • Field Details

    • keys

      public final TreeSet<ColorKey> keys
      The set of keys. Quantized sorting closures should be used as a comparator supplied to this TreeSet's constructor, as it leads to bugs when an unknown number of keys are supplied to the gradient.

  • Constructor Details

    • Gradient

      public Gradient()
      Creates a gradient with two default color keys, clear black at 0.0 and opaque white at 1.0.
      See Also:
      • Color.clearBlack(Color)
      • Color.white(Color)

    • Gradient

      public Gradient(Collection<Color> colors)
      Creates a gradient from a collection of color integers; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      colors - the colors

    • Gradient

      public Gradient(Color color)
      Creates a gradient from a color. The color is placed according to its perceived luminance between black at key 0.0 and white at key 1.0. The boundary keys adopt the color's alpha.
      Parameters:
      color - the color

    • Gradient

      public Gradient(Color... colors)
      Creates a gradient from a list of colors; the resultant keys are evenly distributed over the range [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      colors - the colors

    • Gradient

      Creates a gradient from color keys.
      Parameters:
      keys - the color keys

    • cycle

      public Gradient cycle(int places)
      Cycles the steps of a color gradient. The number of places can be positive or negative, indicating which direction to shift: positive numbers shift to the right; negative, to the left.
      Parameters:
      places - the number of places
      Returns:
      this gradient

      Returns:
      the string

    • toGgrString

      public String toGgrString(String name, int blendType, int colorType)
      Returns a String representation of the gradient compatible with .ggr (GIMP gradient) file formats.

      Blend types include: (0) linear; (1) curved; (2) sine; (3) sphere increasing; (4) sphere decreasing.

      Color types include: (0) RGB, (1) HSV CCW, (2) HSV CW.
      Parameters:
      name - the name
      blendType - the blend type
      colorType - the color type
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgString

      public String toSvgString(String id)
      Returns a String representation of the gradient compatible with the SVG format. Assumes a horizontal linear gradient from left to right.
      Parameters:
      id - the gradient id
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgString

      public String toSvgString(String id, int w, int h)
      Returns a String representation of the gradient compatible with the SVG format. Assumes a horizontal linear gradient from left to right.
      Parameters:
      id - the gradient id
      w - the width
      h - the height
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgString

      public String toSvgString(String id, int w, int h, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2)
      Returns a String representation of the gradient compatible with the SVG format. Assumes a linear gradient with an origin and destination point.

      Because SVG gradients require a defs tag, this class is not compatible with ISvgWritable. This method is a convenience only.
      Parameters:
      id - the gradient id
      w - the width
      h - the height
      x1 - the origin x
      y1 - the origin y
      x2 - the destination x
      y2 - the destination y
      Returns:
      the string

    • clamp01

      public static Gradient clamp01(Gradient source, Gradient target)
      Clamps all colors in a gradient to the range [0.0, 1.0] . Useful for gradients created by mixing colors in color spaces other than standard RGB, e.g., CIE LAB.
      Parameters:
      source - the source gradient
      target - the target gradient
      Returns:
      the clamped gradient
      See Also:
      • Color.clamp01(Color, Color)

    • eval

      public static int eval(Gradient grd, float step)
      Finds a color given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When the step falls between color keys, the resultant color is generated by an easing function.

      For use with images, as this returns an integer following the 0xAARRGGBB format.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      step - the step
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      • Color.toHexIntWrap(Color)
      • TreeSet.floor(Object)
      • TreeSet.ceiling(Object)
      • TreeSet.first()
      • TreeSet.last()
      • Utils.div(float, float)

    • eval

      public static Color eval(Gradient grd, float step, Color target)
      Finds a color given a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] . When the step falls between color keys, the resultant color is created by an easing function.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      step - the step
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      • TreeSet.floor(Object)

    • evalRange

      public static Color[] evalRange(Gradient grd, int count)
      Evaluates an array of colors given a supplied count.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      count - the count
      Returns:
      the array

    • evalRange

      public static Color[] evalRange(Gradient grd, int count, float origin, float dest)
      Evaluates an array of colors given a supplied count. The origin and destination specify the step at the beginning and end of the sample.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      count - the count
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • eval(Gradient, float, Color)

    • evalRange

      public static Color[] evalRange(Gradient grd, int count, float origin, float dest, Color.AbstrEasing easing)
      Evaluates an array of colors given a supplied count. The origin and destination specify the step at the beginning and end of the sample.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      count - the count
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      easing - the easing function
      Returns:
      the array
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • eval(Gradient, float, Color.AbstrEasing, Color)

    • keysByAlpha

      public static Gradient keysByAlpha(Gradient source, Gradient target)
      Sets the step of each color key in a gradient to the transparency of the key's color. Similar to sort(Comparator) in the order of color keys; however, sort leaves key steps unchanged.
      Parameters:
      source - the input gradient
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • keysByLuminance

      public static Gradient keysByLuminance(Gradient source, Gradient target)
      Sets the step of each color key in a gradient to the luminance of the key's color. Similar to sort(Comparator) in the order of color keys; however, sort leaves key steps unchanged.

      Useful when the gradient is applied to an image as a palette swap or a false color with the image's perceived luminance serving as an evaluation factor.
      Parameters:
      source - the input gradient
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient
      See Also:
      • Color.sRgbLuminance(Color)

    • mix

      public static Gradient mix(Gradient origin, Gradient dest, int samples, float step, Gradient target)
      Mixes between two color gradients, producing a new gradient containing uniformly distributed samples. The step provides for how much to mix between the two gradients.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin gradient
      dest - the destination gradient
      samples - the number of samples
      step - the step
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • mix

      public static Gradient mix(Gradient origin, Gradient dest, int samples, Function<Float,Float> stepFunc, Color.AbstrEasing xMixer, Color.AbstrEasing yMixer, Gradient target)
      Mixes between two color gradients, producing a new gradient containing uniformly distributed samples. The first color mixing functional object is supplied to eval(Gradient, float, camzup.core.Color.AbstrEasing, Color) for the origin and destination gradient. A Function supplies the factor for the mixing to the second color mixer at a given sample.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin gradient
      dest - the destination gradient
      samples - the number of samples
      stepFunc - the step supplier
      xMixer - the primary color mixer
      yMixer - the secondary color mixer
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • mix

      public static Gradient mix(Gradient origin, Gradient dest, int samples, Gradient target)
      Mixes between two color gradients, producing a new gradient containing uniformly distributed samples.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin gradient
      dest - the destination gradient
      samples - the number of samples
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteCyanotype

      public static Gradient paletteCyanotype(Gradient target)
      Returns a cyanotype palette, such as those used in creating blueprints, with 8 color keys.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteLcd

      public static Gradient paletteLcd(Gradient target)
      Returns a monochrome palette with 4 colors that simulates an LCD screen.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteMagma

      public static Gradient paletteMagma(Gradient target)
      Returns the Magma color palette, consisting of 16 keys.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteRgb

      public static Gradient paletteRgb(Gradient target)
      Returns seven primary and secondary colors: red, yellow, green, cyan, blue, magenta and red. Red is repeated so that the gradient is periodic.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteRyb

      public static Gradient paletteRyb(Gradient target)
      Returns colors in the red yellow blue color wheel. Red is repeated so that the gradient is periodic.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteSepia

      public static Gradient paletteSepia(Gradient target)
      Returns a sepia tone palette, consisting of 8 keys.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteTemperature

      public static Gradient paletteTemperature(Gradient target)
      Returns a heavily stylized approximation of color temperature, where the middle key (0.5) is white at 6500 Kelvin. The lower bound (0.0), black, is at 800 Kelvin; the upper bound (1.0) is a blue tinted white at 12000 Kelvin.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient

    • paletteViridis

      public static Gradient paletteViridis(Gradient target)
      Returns the Viridis color palette, consisting of 16 keys.
      Parameters:
      target - the output gradient
      Returns:
      the gradient
